title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira's 13-year-old daughter found safe in Massachusetts; she had been missing since July.
17-year-old Nayara Ferreira De Moura, De Oliveira's other daughter, remains missing from DCF custody.
City Councilor Etel Haxhiaj charged with assault following incident during De Oliveira's arrest by ICE agents.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration demands Massachusetts remove references to 'gender ideology' for federally funded education programs.
Massachusetts risks losing $2.36 million in funding if it doesn't revise sex education materials in 60 days.
The demand is part of a broader federal action against LGBTQ+ inclusivity in sex education across multiple states.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão appointed inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC, previously led Benfica to five Campeonato Nacional Feminino titles.
Patão joins Boston, aligning with general manager Domènec Guasch, former Barcelona executive, sharing a similar soccer methodology.
Adapting to Boston entails embracing the NWSL's parity and enjoying local cuisine such as the city's lobster rolls.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman is starting the 2025-26 season without contract disputes that affected his previous year.
Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Bruins after missing last year's training camp.
He aims for a strong season following off-season improvements and a successful showing with Team USA at Worlds.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face his former team, the Raiders, as the Patriots offensive coordinator on Sunday.
McDaniels praises new Raiders coach Pete Carroll and reflects on his learning experiences with the Raiders.
Sunday's game features Patriots' key players like Drake Maye and Stefon Diggs against Raiders' Maxx Crosby.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a Prime Video limited series about the Karen Read murder case.
An informal Boston.com poll showed 48% support for Banks in the role, with some suggesting alternate actresses like Anne Hathaway.
The series will explore themes of true crime and institutional trust, separate from Karen Read's trial screen adaptation.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville, Connecticut, ranked No. 2 on USA Today's list of best non-Vegas casinos.
Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket, Connecticut, secured the No. 3 spot in the 2025 rankings.
USA Today's 10Best Readers' Choice Awards highlight Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods for gaming options and guest experiences.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún is a two-day Irish music festival in Boston featuring bands like Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues.
The Pogues will perform their first U.S. show in over 20 years, closing Seisiún on Sunday at Suffolk Downs.
Tickets range from $75 to $257 for single days, with two-day passes and public transit access available.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen staff accuse leadership of creating a toxic work environment, citing insufficient training and unfulfilled support promises.
Former and current employees report high turnover and a negative workplace culture under long-standing executive director Jen Faigel.
The board of directors expressed support for Faigel, noting challenges faced by nonprofits and promising to address stakeholder concerns.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions, including rent control, advance to the signature collection phase; three were rejected.
Proponents need 74,574 voter signatures by December 3 to progress their proposed laws toward the November 2026 ballot.
Notable proposals include rent control, same-day voter registration, and reductions in state income and gas taxes.
